text: "And Republican Ray LaHood, later nominated Judd Gregg as commerce secretary in the midst of a rapidly worsening economic crisis.

He wanted to work closely with Republican minority in the Senate and house to construct the economic package designed to rescue the economy, the hope was at the time of nearly unprecedented crisis, Republicans should be willing to put politics aside.
So the president instructed his economic team to reach out to Republicans and incorporate their ideas.
which they did, making nearly half the package tax cuts -
